newsitem.title: FINLAND: Nokia profit-takers dent Helsinki, seen adrift.
newsitem.headline: Nokia profit-takers dent Helsinki, seen adrift.

text.p: Shares fell on Tuesday, the index decline almost entirely due to post-results profit-taking in Nokia, and investors otherwise queasy amid fears a German monetary tightening may quash the rally, brokers said.
The FOX portfolio index fell 0.59 percent or just over seven points to 1,234.22, the HEX all-share index shedding 0.78 percent to 3,604.70. Nokia had over half total trade.

Several analysts upgraded earnings forecasts for Nokia after its H1 report late on Monday just pipped expectations, but the absence of a knockout surprise had been expected to unlock some profit-taking, and it ended down 10.10 markka at 471.90.
One broker said Nokia looked to be stabilising around 470.00 markka, seeing the stock supported around 450 markka near term in the absence of any major event.
Nokia's A and K series shares amounted to over six points of the FOX's overall decline, with an uptick in banking group Merita the only remotely significant counterbalance.
Merita put on 0.50 markka to 23.20, recovering some ground after it ran into selling following sharp gains.
Otherwise forestries took a brief lift from slightly above-forecast H1 earnings from Stora, but a dip in UPM -- again heavily traded in late deals -- dragged the sector by the close.

UPM, which has been active but little changed since last week, fell 0.60 markka to 132.60. The only explanation brokers have so far been able to give for the action is "overseas interest" in the share.
